New Records: Harry Kane reached 100 caps for England
Lee Carsley became the first England manager to win his first two competitive games and keep a clean sheet in both since Steve McClaren in 2006
Key Match Events: Harry Kane scored a brace on his 100th cap for England
Trent Alexander-Arnold created five or more chances for England
Lee Carsley's side controlled Finland with precise passing and possession-based football
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley emphasized the importance of creative play and not putting too much pressure on Angel Gomes
Harry Kane expressed his confidence in reaching 100 goals for England
The teams paid tribute to Sven-Goran Eriksson before the match
Post-Match Reflections: Lee Carsley praised Harry Kane's performance and expressed his happiness for the captain
Harry Kane reflected on his special night and expressed his gratitude to his teammates and fans
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in pouring rain at Wembley Stadium
The drink prices at Wembley Stadium were criticized for being high
The match was a special occasion for Harry Kane's 100th cap and Lee Carsley's Wembley debut
